item.title: OGE Online Dissertation and Thesis Preparation Workshop to be held February 19
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. This workshop is for any student who will be writing an MS thesis or PhD dissertation. Bring your questions! Register here!

item.title: McKinney Creative Writing Workshop to be Held 2/21
item.description: Have a story that could inspire others? Ready to raise your voice in solidarity with your community? Want to share your experiences with environmental or social activism? Get help composing or revising an essay, poem, or story for submission to the McKinney Writing for Social Change Contest with author and activist D. Colin on 2/21 at 12pm in the Fischbach Conference Room, on the second floor of the Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: Game Development Club Presents Valentine’s Day Game Jam
item.description: Love is in the air! Join the RPI Game Development Club on February 14 at 6 p.m. in Sage 2411 for a Valentine’s Themed Game Jam, and make a Multiplayer Game in 48 hours to play with the special people in your life! Overnight breaks begin at 10:00 PM on both Friday and Saturday nights and doors re-opening at 8:00 AM each morning. This event is open to RPI students of all majors and all levels of experience! Please contact club president, Aiden Crossfield (crossa2@rpi.edu) for more information and sign up.

item.title: Tesla x RPI Application Workshop, Tech Talk, Networking to be Held February 19 at 2:00 pm
item.description: Tesla will host a session that will provide guidance on the resume-building and application process to help RPI students stand out! Immediately following the Tech Talk, Tesla will transition to a networking event in the DCC Great Hall where students can speak one-to-one with engineering managers. Seating is limited, so register in Handshake!

item.title: Systems Engineering & Technology Management Review Scheduled for February 13
item.description: Thursday, February 13, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.

item.title: Analytics, Machine Learning and AI Review
item.description: Wednesday, February 19, 2025 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., on a 30-minute information session highlighting Rensselaer online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning & AI. Expect to learn how data can inform better decisions and review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register if you plan to attend.

item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department at noon on 2/12 for a presentation titled “HARMONIC: Cognitive and Control Collaboration in Human-Robotic Teams” by Dr. Sanjay Oruganti, Research Scientist in the Language-Endowed Intelligent Agents (LEIA) Lab at RPI’s Cognitive Science Department (Carnegie 113).

item.title: “Whose Data Is It Anyway?” Celebrate #LoveData25
item.description: RPI Libraries celebrates Love Data Week 2025, an international data event held annually in February. This year’s theme, “Whose Data Is It Anyway?”, explores data ownership, provenance, and data collection. Libraries worldwide are hosting events with workshops, talks, and games. Love Data Week aims to raise awareness about data literacy and responsible data use. Find out more about International Love Data Week.

item.title: HR to Hold Professional Development Workshop, “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description: Description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, scheduled to be held from 9am to 11am on February 20, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.

item.title: As of 02/12/2025, RPI managed computers will lock after 15 minutes of inactivity
item.description: Starting 02/12/2025, RPI managed computers will lock after an activity time out of 15 minutes. Devices unused for 15 minutes will be locked requiring your login password to unlock. This measure complies with data privacy regulations to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information if an individual leaves their computer unattended, ensuring that only the authorized individual can access the system by requiring a password to log back in after the inactivity period.

item.title: Have YOU Joined the Teaching and Learning Newsflash List Yet?
item.description:
A list for faculty interested in instructional technologies, pedagogy, and innovative tools for classroom engagement, the Teaching and Learning e-Newsflash has been created to support faculty who wish to try new technologies and strategies for learning. Subscribers will also be notified about any on-campus teaching and learning workshops/events.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
